001package com.exoreaction.xorcery.dns.server.tcp;
002
003import com.exoreaction.xorcery.dns.server.DnsServerService;
004import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
005import org.eclipse.jetty.io.AbstractConnection;
006import org.eclipse.jetty.io.EndPoint;
007import org.eclipse.jetty.util.BufferUtil;
008import org.eclipse.jetty.util.IteratingCallback;
009import org.xbill.DNS.Message;
010import org.xbill.DNS.Section;
011import org.xbill.DNS.WireParseException;
012
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
015import java.util.concurrent.Executor;
016
017public class DNSTCPConnection extends AbstractConnection {
018    private final IteratingCallback callback = new DNSIteratingCallback();
019    private final DnsServerService dnsServerService;
020    private final Logger logger;
021
022    public DNSTCPConnection(EndPoint endPoint, Executor executor, DnsServerService dnsServerService, Logger logger) {
023        super(endPoint, executor);
024        this.dnsServerService = dnsServerService;
025        this.logger = logger;
026        logger.debug("DNS connection from {}", endPoint.getRemoteSocketAddress().toString());
027    }
028
029    @Override
030    public void onOpen() {
031        super.onOpen();
032
033        // Declare interest in being called back when
034        // there are bytes to read from the network.
035        fillInterested();
036    }
037
038    @Override
039    public void onFillable() {
040        callback.iterate();
041    }
042
043    private class DNSIteratingCallback extends IteratingCallback {
044        private ByteBuffer buffer;
045
046        @Override
047        protected Action process() throws Throwable {
048            if (buffer == null)
049                buffer = BufferUtil.allocate(Message.MAXLENGTH, true);
050            int length = -1;
051            while (true) {
052                int filled = getEndPoint().fill(buffer);
053
054                if (buffer.limit() >= 2 && length == -1) {
055                    length = buffer.getShort();
056                }
057
058                if (filled > 0) {
059                    if (buffer.limit() == length + 2) {
060                        try {
061                            // TODO Convert this into an async handling
062                            Message request = new Message(buffer);
063                            Message response = new Message(request.getHeader().getID());
064                            response.addRecord(request.getQuestion(), Section.QUESTION);
065
066                            if (logger.isDebugEnabled())
067                                logger.debug("Request:" + request.toString());
068                            dnsServerService.handle(request, response);
069                            if (logger.isDebugEnabled())
070                                logger.debug("Response:" + response.toString());
071                            byte[] resp = response.toWire();
072
073                            // Prefix with length
074                            byte[] bytes = new byte[2 + resp.length];
075                            bytes[0] = (byte) (resp.length >>> 8);
076                            bytes[1] = (byte) (resp.length & 0xFF);
077                            System.arraycopy(resp, 0, bytes, 2, resp.length);
078
079                            getEndPoint().flush(ByteBuffer.wrap(bytes));
080                            fillInterested();
081
082                            return Action.IDLE;
083                        } catch (WireParseException e) {
084                            // Continue
085                        } catch (IOException e) {
086                            onCompleteFailure(e);
087                        }
088                    }
089                } else if (filled == 0) {
090                    // We don't need the buffer anymore, so
091                    // don't keep it around while we are idle.
092                    buffer = null;
093
094                    // No more bytes to read, declare
095                    // again interest for fill events.
096                    fillInterested();
097
098                    // Signal that the iteration is now IDLE.
099                    return Action.IDLE;
100                } else {
101                    // The other peer closed the connection,
102                    // the iteration completed successfully.
103                    return Action.SUCCEEDED;
104                }
105            }
106        }
107
108        @Override
109        protected void onCompleteSuccess() {
110            logger.debug("onCompleteSuccess");
111            getEndPoint().close();
112        }
113
114        @Override
115        protected void onCompleteFailure(Throwable cause) {
116            logger.debug("onCompleteFailure", cause);
117            getEndPoint().close(cause);
118        }
119    }
120}
